executive_summary: The Online Television Sales industry is expected to grow significantly over the five years to 2021 as consumers have continued to shift to shopping online. Industry revenue has increased at an annualized rate of 7.9% to $6.2 billion over the five years to 2021, including an increase of 7.3% in 2021 alone. The industry experienced significant growth in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic increasing online shopping popularity. Despite challenges like competition from brick-and-mortar stores and other devices, profit has continued to increase.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: IBISWorld estimates that industry revenue will increase at an annualized rate of 7.9% to $6.2 billion over the five years to 2021, including an increase of 7.3% in 2021 alone.
In 2021, IBISWorld estimates that industry profit will account for 6.3% of industry revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry is expected to continue experiencing growth over the five years to 2026, with industry revenue increasing at an annualized rate of 5.1% to $8.0 billion.
Increasing competition from evolving technologies will continue to pose a potential threat to the industry.
Industry profit is expected to increase over the five years to 2026, accounting for 6.5% of industry revenue in 2026.

industry_definition: This industry retails TV sets via the internet. Industry goods are typically purchased from domestic (in some cases international) manufacturers and wholesalers, and then sold to the public online.

negative_impact_factors: Low and steady barriers to entry level

weaknesses: Low and steady barriers to entry
Low and steady level of assistance

key_trends: The growth of the industry is primarily due to the increase in internet use among consumers
Physical stores have advantages over online retailers in providing product support and face-to-face customer service
Profit has been supported by strengthening supply chains and expanding economies of scale
The industry will continue to experience competition from other electronic devices providing similar services as TVs
Online TV retailers benefit from low operational costs compared to brick-and-mortar stores
Some customers remain hesitant to purchase TVs online due to potentially high shipping costs and limited customer service
Online retailers are offering free shipping and boosting customer service to adjust to customer preferences

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers who are younger than 25 account for the smallest share of Online Television Sales industry revenue in 2021.
Consumers aged 25 to 44 are expected to represent the second-largest market segment for the industry, accounting for 36.4% of total revenue.
Consumers aged 45 to 64 are expected to account for 36.8% of revenue in 2021, making this age group the largest market segment for the industry.
Consumers aged 65 and older are expected to account for 15.7% of industry revenue in 2021.

products_and_services.product_description: TVs below 30 inches wide are anticipated to account for only 3.0% of Online Television Sales industry revenue in 2021.
TVs between 30 and 39 inches wide are expected to make up 15.4% of industry revenue in 2021.
TVs between 40 and 59 inches make up the majority of online TV sales in 2021, accounting for 57.6% of industry revenue.
TVs 60 inches and wider are expected to account for 24.0% of industry revenue in 2021, making this the second-largest segment.

tier_1_suppliers: Major Household Appliance Manufacturing in the US
TV & Appliance Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Consumer Preferences and Online Shopping Trends
demand_determinants.determinant_description: During the economic downturn associated with the COVID-19 pandemic, consumers increasingly searched online for discounts on TV sets, and even bypassed the newest TVs with better resolutions in favor of the more affordable options.

Online TV purchases are driven by the growing prevalence of online shopping and increased consumer spending online since online TV sellers can offer reduced prices by using a website as their storefront and delivering from central warehouses.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Domestic operators in the Online Television Sales industry supply both the domestic and international market through online websites.

business_locations.location_description: In the West, companies are near the Pacific market, with California holding the largest share of establishments at 18.0%. Altogether, the West region holds 24.7% of industry establishments in 2021, making it the most popular destination for industry establishments.

The Southeast contains the second-largest share of industry establishments in 2021, with 21.7% of all establishments. Within the Southeast, most establishments are located in Florida, which contains 9.2% of establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic accounts for 17.0% of industry establishments, with New York being the most popular home for establishments within the region, holding 8.9% of establishments.
The Great Lakes region accounts for 11.2% of industry establishments.
The Southwest region accounts for 9.5% of industry establishments.
The Rocky Mountains region accounts for 6.1% of industry establishments.
The Plains region accounts for 5% of industry establishments.
The New England region accounts for 5% of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry is not heavily regulated but must adhere to federal and state rules regarding privacy, security, copyright, taxation, and e-commerce laws.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Changing tax laws relating to e-commerce businesses
regulations_points.regulation_description: Changing tax laws could significantly affect industry firms, threatening profitability and increasing operating costs, particularly for small businesses.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Temporary regulations due to COVID-19 pandemic
regulations_points.regulation_description: Temporary regulations were established due to COVID-19, with physical retailers facing restrictions while e-commerce sales increased as consumers preferred online shopping.

factors_decreased_barrier: The Online Television Sales industry has low barriers to entry since no significant capital investments are necessary and the skill level to compete successfully in the industry is comparatively low and requires no licensing or certification process.

However, new entrants will contend with several challenges, including contending with the established reputations, name brands and marketing power of large industry players and the high level of price-based competition in a saturated market that is fast-approaching maturity.

basis_points.basis_description: Online shoppers are mostly searching for bargains online, and companies that can offer lower prices will likely experience increased sales. While product and service prices are relatively stable between players in the industry, shipping charges can vary significantly.

The overall reputation of an operator in this industry has a significant impact on repeat buyers. Due to the absence of a physical storefront, consumer awareness of online retailers comes from media advertising and, more importantly, from word of mouth.

basis_points.basis_title: The user experience and design of a website are critical for industry success.
basis_points.basis_description: Operators need to ensure that all TVs for sale are accompanied by a detailed description (e.g. color, size, functionality and quantity). Due to the online-based nature of this industry, consumers are not able to physically examine the products before buying them.

Consumers increasingly seek reliable online shopping sites where they know that they will be helped in the event of a problem with the delivery or quality of a purchased TV, or should they need to request a refund.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Online Television Sales industry has a low level of market share concentration since the majority of the industry comprises small companies. In 2021, more than 80.0% of industry establishments employ fewer than 10 workers.
The three largest players are expected to account for 18.4% of industry revenue in 2021.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Online shopping operators outlay capital on technology to establish, implement and maintain websites where consumers place orders.
The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, but the concentration of technologies is high. The industry structure is accommodative for new entrants.
Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified, suggesting limited entry points other than those already served by incumbents.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Online Television Sales industry has a moderate level of capital intensity. For every $1.00 spent on wages, industry operators will spend $0.15 in capital investment.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Online Television Sales industry has experienced low revenue volatility over the five years to 2021 as demand has remained strong and revenue has grown consistently.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Online Television Sales industry itself is a source of technological disruption, with e-commerce gaining popularity and companies enhancing mobile applications.
The level of technology change is high, with advancements influencing the types of TV sets sold and the manner in which the industry sells products.

FAQs.question: How has your businesses adapted to the growth of online sales over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Brick-and-mortar retailers must appreciate the threat of the emergence of e-commerce. Companies without an online presence will likely be forced out of the industry over the coming years. This trend is expected to be accelerated by the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: While the industry as a whole is generally reliant on the overall health of the US economy, online retail is less dependent. Adverse economic conditions may depress industry revenue, but should not reverse the industry's course. The coronavirus pandemic is expected to increase industry revenue as it provides consumers with an outlet for socially distanced TV shopping. In 2021 alone, industry revenue is expected to increase 7.3%.

FAQs.question: Does your company look to lease equipment in order to reduce overhead costs?
FAQs.answer: Companies should look to make investment in warehouse equipment and technology to increase operational productivity and efficiency. In 2021, depreciation costs are expected to account for 0.7% of total industry revenue.

FAQs.question: Have your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand reach and reduce overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Some online TV retailers are looking to vertically integrate through acquiring companies in different industries. Traditionally brick and mortar stores are looking for e-commerce and technology startups to help them grow their online platform. Merger and acquisition activity may increase due to the coronavirus as smaller operators are unable to survive the poor economic climate.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Using robotic technology, orders can be fulfilled and sent out for delivery quicker. While large companies have and continue to invest and acquire robotic technology companies, small operators can partner with these companies or use a third-party logistics company to handle operations. Wages are expected to account for 4.4% of industry revenue in 2021.

FAQs.question: Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems to ensure that the most popular products are kept in stock?
FAQs.answer: Operators should be aware of new POS technologies, including the new blockchain technology, that can improve inventory operations. Companies should also collect and analyze selling data in order to have a better understanding of how to order inventory.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Many states have enacted e-commerce tax laws in recent years, which puts these retailers on a more level playing field with brick-and-mortar stores. Regulations relating to the coronavirus, including social distancing, mask mandates and increased cleaning procedures, are expected to increase operating costs, which may pressure profit.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies should consult state and local officials to ensure all regulatory requirements are met. With the rise of automation, some companies may neglect the significance of regulation. Operators must adhere to coronavirus related regulations. These may differ state to state.

FAQs.question: What ongoing financing challenges does your company face?
FAQs.answer: Companies should look to leasing equipment and warehouse space if financing proves challenging. The coronavirus has disrupted many sectors in the economy and continues to be a threat for many industries financials.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Generally, online retail is a B2C business, so companies should not face challenges having customers pay on time. Some startups, however, allow customers to pay for purchases in monthly installments. Uncertain economic conditions due to the coronavirus may increase the risk of customers not paying on time.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain optimum stock levels? What factors affect demand and stock levels?
FAQs.answer: To profit from trends, operators need to be able to control stock on hand to ensure that they have an adequate amount of popular items. The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic is expected to make it more challenging for operators to maintain optimum stock levels as consumer behavior continues to change.

FAQs.question: What do you do to maintain a good reputation?
FAQs.answer: Having a good reputation is key for operators to create a loyal customer base. Successful operators may gain and maintain a good reputation through excellent customer service and by employing knowledgeable workers.

FAQs.question: How quickly can do you adopt new technology, such as warehouse automation tech? What are the associated costs?
FAQs.answer: Ever-changing software systems, warehouse technology and personal information security systems require companies to continually update their business to keep pace with recent technology.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the percentage of services conducted online? How have you benefited from the rise in remote work, such as during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic?
FAQs.answer: The percentage of services conducted online reflects consumer preferences toward purchasing items and conducting serviced online. The percentage of services conducted online is expected to decrease in 2021. However, this is primarily in response to the large spike in 2020 due to the coronavirus.

FAQs.question: How are you affected by an increase in the number of mobile internet connections?
FAQs.answer: Consumers are increasingly using mobile internet connections to purchase products on the go, increasing the convenience of online shopping. The number of mobile internet connections is expected to increase in 2021.

FAQs.question: How did your company fare amid the pandemic's resulting economic climate? How have you performed with overall growth in disposable income?
FAQs.answer: When per capita disposable income is high, consumers are more likely to purchase discretionary goods, such as TVs, benefitting the industry. Per capita disposable income is expected to increase in 2021.
